author: mheathsmith
title: Chelsea ‘hold talks with one of China’s richest companies’ over huge investment to help fund Stamford Bridge regeneration
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CHELSEA have met with one of China’s richest companies – as Roman Abramovich eyes outside support to compete financially with Premier League rivals. 
According to the Daily Mail , Blues chairman Bruce Buck held talks with mega-rich conglomerate HNA Group last month. Reuters 4 Roman Abramovich could sell a stake in Chelsea to mega-rich Chinese investors 
The Fortune Global 500 company – which has an annual revenue of over £20BILLION – is understood to be desperate to invest in a Prem club. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
It is reported that Buck met the group on January 7, and they were then invited into the Stamford Bridge directors’ box for the 4-1 FA Cup win over Peterborough the next day. 
That was the second meeting between the two parties – with Buck previously having flown to Asia for talks. 4 Blues Chairman Bruce Buck has held talks with HNA Group 
A source confirmed to the Mail that HNA are ‘serious about buying a club’ and it is thought they have made formal representations to at least one other English side in recent years. 
HNA are understood to be keen to purchase a 20 per cent stake in Chelsea which – with the club valued at £1.2bn by Forbes last year – would be worth roughly £240m. 
That figure is a staggering £100m MORE than Abramovich paid Ken Bates for the Blues in 2003. 60,000 seater Chelsea stadium set for approval as Stamford Bridge gets makeover Related Stories Bon appetit Man City and Chelsea on red alert after £50m-rated Leonardo Bonucci rows with Juventus boss Max Allegri Box-to-box midfielder Diego Costa jokingly keeps Eden Hazard out of Real Madrid's clutches by trapping Chelsea pal in cardboard box BLUE INK Eden Hazard is Real Madrid's top summer target - but Chelsea star drops huge hint he will stay at Stamford Bridge Ed Start Chelsea superstar Eden Hazard 'on the verge of agreeing Real Madrid move after months of secret talks' Keep up with the Jones Chelsea boss Antonio Conte meets England rugby coach Eddie Jones, saying, 'It's important I gain future ideas' Ooh Le Le Former France and Chelsea star turn actor Frank Leboeuf's model daughter Jade is making a name for herself as a topless model Sweet FA Jose Mourinho fumes as Man United's FA Cup tie at Chelsea is moved to Monday on Europa League week Cesc in a knot Cesc Fabregas mocked by former Spain team-mate David Villa for having NO IDEA how to do up a tie 
But the eventual investment could be even more valuable, with another Chinese consortium paying £265m for just a 13 per cent stake in Manchester City in 2015 . 
Chelsea are likely to use the funds to push ahead with their Stamford Bridge regeneration project , for which they were given the green light last month. 
The £500m revamp will see stadium capacity increased to 60,000 and help keep the club on a level playing field with the likes of Arsenal , Man City , Manchester United and Liverpool , as well as Tottenham when they move to their new 61,000-seater ground next year. Getty Images Investment could help Antonio Conte spend big to add to Chelsea's squad PA:Press Association 4 Manchester United spent a world record £89m on Paul Pogba last summer 
Investment will also enable Chelsea to continue to compete with the likes of United – who splashed a world-record £89million on Paul Pogba last summer – in the transfer market.
